titleStmt.title: The Irish cabinet: or His Majesties secret papers, for establishing the Papall clergy in Ireland, with other matters of high concernment, taken in the carriages of the Archbishop of Tuam, who was slain in the late fight at Sliggo in that kingdom. Together with two exact and full relations of the severall victories obtained by the Parliaments forces, through Gods blessing, in the same kingdom. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that His Majesties papers taken at Sliggo, be forthwith printed and published: H: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Cole, William,
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edw. Husband, printer to the Honorable House of Commons, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Golden Dragon in Fleetstreet, neer the Inner-Temple,

notesStmt.note: Formerly attributed by Wing to William Cole, who in fact is merely the author of the last item.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the sign of the Golden Dragon in Fleetstreet, neer the Inner-Temple
